headline: S&P Global: The Maturity Wall Presents A Huge Opportunity Heading Into 2025
summary: Discover why S&P Global's ratings segment is a high-margin, fortress-like business poised for growth, making it a compelling investment opportunity.

headline: NORTH AMERICAN MANUFACTURERS BEGIN STOCKPILING TO BUFFER AGAINST TARIFFS WHILE ASIAN SUPPLIERS RECORD RENEWED GROWTH AS CHINESE MANUFACTURING REBOUNDS, DRIVEN BY STIMULUS AND EXPORTS: GEP GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN VOLATILITY INDEX
summary: The GEP Global Supply Chain Volatility Index — a leading indicator tracking demand conditions, shortages, transportation costs, inventories and backlogs based on a monthly survey of 27,000 businesses — signaled the smallest level of spare capacity in global supply chains since June in November, as the index rose to -0.20, from -0.39 previously.

raw.headline: NORTH AMERICAN MANUFACTURERS BEGIN STOCKPILING TO BUFFER AGAINST TARIFFS WHILE ASIAN SUPPLIERS RECORD RENEWED GROWTH AS CHINESE MANUFACTURING REBOUNDS, DRIVEN BY STIMULUS AND EXPORTS: GEP GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN VOLATILITY INDEX
raw.summary: The GEP Global Supply Chain Volatility Index — a leading indicator tracking demand conditions, shortages, transportation costs, inventories and backlogs based on a monthly survey of 27,000 businesses — signaled the smallest level of spare capacity in global supply chains since June in November, as the index rose to -0.20, from -0.39 previously.

headline: TPM, S&P Global's Premier Shipping and Supply Chain Conference, to Celebrate 25th Anniversary in 2025
summary: TPM, organized by the Journal of Commerce within S&P Global, will be held in Long Beach, California, on March 2–5, 2025. This will mark the 25th anniversary of TPM, the premier global container shipping and supply chain conference.

summary: UK consumer confidence deteriorated in December, data published by S&P Global showed Monday. The UK S&P Global consumer sentiment index fell to 46.6 in December from 46.9 in November. Falling...
